job.title: Senior Engineer, Embedded Software
job.description: stronguJob DescriptionbrbrustrongRockwell Automation is doing things never before possible  We connect the imaginations of people with the potential of technology to make the world more intelligent more connected and more productive We help the world work better and people work smarter and are looking for bright minds to make that happen The makers the forward thinkers the problem solvers Thats where you come inbrbrRockwell Automation is looking for an innovative engineer to join our global Software and Control organization in Milwaukee WI You will be part of a new product development team with a focus on design development and test of embedded software and features for programmable logic controllers PLCs You will also contribute to the overall product requirements process and tools An ideal candidate will exhibit the ability to flex between product software design development and test activities Given tightly coupled hardware and software in our products previous embedded software experience is a plusbrbrstronguEssential FunctionsbrustrongulliDesign and develop embedded software for Programmable Logic ControllersliliBuild and maintain automated tests in support of new and existing product featuresliliWork in a variety of hardware and software environments ranging from commercial offtheshelf to custom System on Chip architectures and from general purpose to embedded realtime operating systemsliliUse modern continuous integration and development tools and promote continuous improvement of tools and practices across the global development organizationliliDemonstrate a strong understanding of objectoriented programming concepts C and Python are preferredliliOperate across the entire software development life cycle requirements management design implementation test release and maintenanceliliWork on an Agile development team within a larger Scaled Agile Framework organization participating in short term sprint medium term program increment and long term product roadmap planningliliMentor less experienced personnel and encourage knowledge sharing and learning among the development communitybrliulstronguBasic QualificationsbrustrongulliBachelors degree in Computer Engineering Computer Science Electrical Engineering or similar disciplinebrliulstronguPreferred QualificationsbrustrongulliExperience developing software and automated tests and tools in objectoriented languages such as C or PythonliliBachelors degree in Computer Engineering Computer Science Electrical EngineeringliliTypically requires a minimum of 5 years of software engineering experience with demonstrated professional development in software design and implementationliliAbility to understand and apply knowledge of objectoriented analysis design and programming techniquesliliExperience with automation frameworks and tools developmentliliExperience in requirements decomposition and test traceabilityliliExperience in using open source tools like Git and JenkinsliliKnowledge of unit testing using tools like CppUnit unittest etcliliExperience with continuous integration environments automated test and acceptance testingliliExperience working in an Agile development setting and Agile project toolsliliExperience working with industrial protocols especially Common Industrial Protocol CIPliliExperience developing software and test to safety and security standards such as IEC 61508 or IEC 62443liliAdvanced courses or degree in engineering computer science or controlsliulstrong This position is part of a job family Experience will be the determining factor brbrstrongWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veteransbrbrIf you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process please contact our services team at 1 844 4047427brbr
